disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.desc: For now, only the contents of this page are actually functional, so feel free to get in contact with me if you wish to! The projects pages currently link to their respective GitHub repositories. I'm working on case studies for them, so stay tuned!

hero.h1: Hi everyone! I am a software engineer, designer, and... hmm, a cool-stuff maker.

about.me: I am a systems developer graduate. And oh boy, do I love creating! Fullstack is my passion, but if you asked what I prefer... backend is kind of my roman empire

projects.title: Projects
projects.desc: I love engineering software, that's my main game. My problem-solving mind enables me to come up with creative ideas and solutions.

work.title: Let's work together
work.desc: What do you have in mind for your next project?

05.title: Leave your message
05.desc: Hi Gustavo, so I needed your help with...

invalid.desc: You might have forgotten to fill out some of the form fields or filled them incorrectly. Please check on them.
invalid.title: Invalid data

success.desc: Your message has been sent successfully. I'll get back to you via the email entered as soon as possible.
success.title: Message sent

error.desc: An error occurred while sending your message. Please verify if you input a valid email address.
error.title: Error sending message

intro.desc: Ever needed to find an accommodation off-campus? Probably not... But high schoolers have. What about how they do it? Are roommates even a thing for off-campus people? That's what we'll find out.

context.desc: The research was made locally, with a pool of senior uni applicants. From that, I was able to affirm whether my solution (yet to be seen) would be efficient and sensible.

findings.desc: 85% of the students in question stated they'd study abroad or away from home if they had the opportunity to. However, 95% said they neither had any idea where they'd live nor how they'd find such.

solution.title: Rethinking uni accommodations
solution.desc: An iOS application was the way I found to solve the problem. The app provides their users with an intuitive interface that allows students and landlords to connect, so that off-campus people can get a little bit closer to on-campus benefits.
solution.sub: A way to find a place.

dev.frontDesc: Developed with Swift and SwiftUI. Performance designed at its core.
dev.backDesc: The server logic was made with JavaScript and Express.js, in the Node.js runtime environment.

conclusion.desc: Students that need to study off-campus are expected to benefit from the application, since they'll be able to connect with roommates and landlords.
